gov.sandia.cognition.learning.function.categorization

Class ScalarFunctionToBinaryCategorizerAdapter<InputType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cognition.util.AbstractCloneableSerializable
      • gov.sandia.cognition.learning.function.categorization.AbstractBinaryCategorizer<InputType>
        • gov.sandia.cognition.learning.function.categorization.AbstractDiscriminantBinaryCategorizer<InputType>
          • gov.sandia.cognition.learning.function.categorization.AbstractThresholdBinaryCategorizer<InputType>
            • gov.sandia.cognition.learning.function.categorization.ScalarFunctionToBinaryCategorizerAdapter<InputType>
  • Type Parameters:
    InputType - Input to the discriminant function.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Evaluator<InputType,java.lang.Boolean>, BinaryCategorizer<InputType>, Categorizer<InputType,java.lang.Boolean>, DiscriminantBinaryCategorizer<InputType>, DiscriminantCategorizer<InputType,java.lang.Boolean,java.lang.Double>, ThresholdBinaryCategorizer<InputType>, CloneableSerializable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FisherLinearDiscriminantBinaryCategorizer

    public class ScalarFunctionToBinaryCategorizerAdapter<InputType>
extends AbstractThresholdBinaryCategorizer<InputType>
    Adapts a scalar function to be a categorizer using a threshold.
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Justin Basilico

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public ScalarFunctionToBinaryCategorizerAdapter<InputType> clone()
        Description copied from class: AbstractCloneableSerializable
        This makes public the clone method on the Object class and removes the exception that it throws. Its default behavior is to automatically create a clone of the exact type of object that the clone is called on and to copy all primitives but to keep all references, which means it is a shallow copy. Extensions of this class may want to override this method (but call super.clone() to implement a "smart copy". That is, to target the most common use case for creating a copy of the object. Because of the default behavior being a shallow copy, extending classes only need to handle fields that need to have a deeper copy (or those that need to be reset). Some of the methods in ObjectUtil may be helpful in implementing a custom clone method. Note: The contract of this method is that you must use super.clone() as the basis for your implementation.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface CloneableSerializable
        Overrides:
        clone in class AbstractCloneableSerializable
        Returns:
        A clone of this object.

      • evaluateWithoutThreshold

        protected double evaluateWithoutThreshold(InputType input)
        Description copied from class: AbstractThresholdBinaryCategorizer
        Computes the discriminant. This maps the input space onto the real line, which will then be passed to the threshold.
        Specified by:
        evaluateWithoutThreshold in class AbstractThresholdBinaryCategorizer<InputType>
        Parameters:
        input - Input to map onto the real number line.
        Returns:
        Real-value equivalent of the input.
